comment: If I'm not mistaken it's Boleslavsky's idea. Of course it's a more common approach to take with a pawn towards the centre, but here White has a concrete purpose: to exploit the "backward" c7 pawn . To do this, White opens the c-file and tries to prevent c7-c5. The next White goal: to exchange black-squared bishops and occupy black square with pieces.
reasoning: The comment accurately describes the strategic purpose of the move, identifying it as Boleslavsky's idea, and explains the concrete goal White aims to achieve by exploiting the "backward" c7 pawn.
